content.description: The base of a solid is the region in the first quadrant bounded by the <math alttext="y" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>-axis, the <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis, the graph of <math alttext="y equals, e to the x power" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></math>, and the vertical line <math alttext="x equals 1" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></math>. For this solid, each cross section perpendicular to the <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis is a square.
content.question: What is the volume of the solid?

choices.label: <math alttext="one half e squared, minus one half" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="one half e squared, minus one half" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
